programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Events involving military and intelligence agencies, with suggestions of cover-ups relating to two unexplained incidents in the east of England in 1956 and 1980

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Stories of UFO sightings and alien abductions, beginning with reports of multiple bright aerial lights near Tinley Park, Illinois, in 2004.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths are tasked to craft a signature blade from a massive piece of lift cable. The final two competitors return home to re-create a sword wielded by some of history's fiercest soldiers - the Two-Handed Landsknecht Sword.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: An internationally-inspired signature dish sees one chef's dream of winning go up in flames. The Crossfire Round offers a chance to catch up and the judges enjoy Greek feasts.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: The competition really hots up in the Crossfire Round and the Feast of Fire sees the chefs serving up the ultimate comfort food.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley comes out from behind the security glass to confront a menacing customer, and there is more trouble when a man claims he has been robbed in the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley is in trouble with Seth and Les, who discover she is to blame for the shop's current cash crisis.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth finds himself in the cross hairs after his new employee makes a big mistake, while Ashley is forced to face one of her most insulting customers yet.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: As a storm threatens to knock out the shop's power, Seth hatches an emergency plan - only for it to be shot down by his father.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les's relationship deteriorates further as a string of problems in the warehouse threatens to bleed the business dry.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions are at an all-time high in the store as Seth and Les tussle for power and Ashley intervenes when the chaos begins to affect business.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Everyone's eyes are on Seth as he tries to prove he is worthy of being in charge, while also attempting to keep calm as the pressure begins to mount.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth makes a costly mistake that threatens to land the business in financial disaster. While he tries to correct it, Ashley spills the beans to Les.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey checks out a 1972 telegram that prevents Muhammad Ali from fighting in Alaska, and a first edition copy of Oscar Wilde's The Happy Prince arrives in store.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1957 Harley-Davidson Sportster roars into the shop, and Rick takes a look at a painting of Vietnamese Communist leader Ho Chi Minh.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick unrolls work by Shepard Fairey, the artist that produced the famous President Obama posters. Corey and Chumlee look for a deal on a Mork figurine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick uncovers an 1800s first edition book about the Underground Railroad, as well as a set of baseball cards given to troops during Desert Shield.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick looks for a knockout deal on a set of handprints signed by Sylvester Stallone. Meanwhile, Chumlee enters an arm-wrestling competition.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Revolutionary war documents signed by King George III show up in the shop. Plus, Chumlee checks out a pair of Pushman Scooters.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed Red Hot Chili Peppers album and a Mobo Bronco toy are brought into the shop, and their true values leave everyone guessing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A baseball thought to be autographed by 1959 World Series Champions the LA Dodgers shows up, and Rick looks for a snappy deal on a rare 1930s movie camera.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Bodie fixes up a 1959 Ford F100 in Los Angeles, while in Michigan, Andy takes an emotional ride restoring a 1940's JC Higgins bike, and Bob's Garage resurrects a 1930's gas pump.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: In the Second World War, Suffolk was home to 32 airfields that served as stations for US bombers. Suggs and Stephen hunt for relics of the visiting aircraft.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor bring forgotten stories of the Second World War back to life by unearthing artefacts from former military sites across the UK. Here, the duo look for relics of the 1944 D-Day operation.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.sub-title: A Photo a Tooth the Truth?
programme.desc: Two potentially game-changing discoveries are made in the Ozarks as the investigation into whether giant humanoids ever roamed America continues.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The US military has denied that the infamous 1947 Roswell crash was anything other than a weather balloon, but FBI files include a memo to J Edgar Hoover.

programme.title: Barbarians Rising
programme.desc: The rise and fall of the Roman Empire from the perspective of the rebel tribes that brought the Empire to its knees, beginning with the story of Hannibal of Carthage, who built the first great barbarian alliance to defeat Rome before it became unstoppable.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Matt LeBlanc, Chris Harris and Rory Reid buy three used luxury limousines from Rolls-Royce, Bentley and Mercedes for the price of the cheapest new car in Britain. The glamorous cars are then put through their paces in a gruelling six-hour endurance challenge at Silverstone. Plus, Countryfile's Matt Baker drops in to the studio.

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his journey through Croatia and savours the native oysters of Ston, before crossing the border into Albania, where he is joined by his son Jack and the pair sample local dishes such as chicken jufka and kokoretsi. In his own kitchen on the Greek island of Symi, Rick cooks traditional Albanian dishes, including Lepur Comlek and Tave Kosi.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike makes a mistake in Indiana, and while the guys get a warm reception from a carnie collector in Ohio, the pick brings an unexpected sting.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys visit a man who has not thrown away anything since the 1950s, and is not willing to start now. And he also has a penchant for swimming trunks.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori discover a flamethrower in a storage unit.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon bids on a selection of nude photos, but Lori does not believe they have much value.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori head to an airport storage and luggage auction to bid for the cast-offs of the rich and famous.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are in Alton, Hampshire, where Linda is concerned that the other bidders are taking advantage of her superior knowledge and her looks. Meanwhile, Boudicca and Heavy D form more than just a business partnership, and Barry impresses with his dainty footwork.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A man kidnapped and beaten by a Mexican drug cartel flees across the bridge into America. At Progreso International Bridge, a woman is caught hiding anti-anxiety pills in her bra.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Austin, Eddie Hall takes on Superbike legend Colin 'Texas Tornado' Edwards in a strength vs speed race - and sets his own eating challenge from eight of the city's food trucks.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Manhattan, Eddie Hall goes head to head with long-time rival Brian Shaw, pulling a 23-tonne truck - and attempting the notorious skyscraper 'Monster' sandwich from Sarge's Deli.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Stoke strongman Eddie Hall visits cosmopolitan Queens, NY, to make a solo attempt at a huge Greek kebab banquet, sample the best Chinese dumplings and try his hand at baseball.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compare the Mercedes SLS, the Porsche 911 GT3 RS and the Ferrari 458 Italia, as they race against each other in an epic road trip up America's east coast.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Olympic cycling gold-medallist Chris Hoy, impressionist Ronni Ancona, writer and producer Danny Wallace and sports presenter Gabby Logan join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Fashionista Trinny Woodall, actor Reece Shearsmith, West End star Michael Ball and critic Charlie Brooker join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? - The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: Highlights from the third series of the comedy panel show presented by Rob Brydon. Featuring team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack alongside guests including Fern Britton, Ken Livingstone, Davina McCall, Russell Howard and Claudia Winkleman.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: The will-they-won't-they tension between Lee and Lucy reaches unseen new highs in this epic finale for Christmas. Sally Bretton, Bobby Ball and Katy Wix co-star.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Seven years into their marriage, Lee and Lucy face the daily onslaught of raising Charlie and his twin siblings, five-year-olds Benji and Molly. Lovably feckless father Frank remains around and close friends including world-weary Toby and uptight ice-queen Anna are still on the scene. Thankfully, Lucy's more dependable parents Geoffrey and Wendy can be relied upon when the going gets tough. However, while juggling the ongoing needs of those around him, the pair disagree about the best way to keep the romance alive. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Ed Byrne, Milton Jones, Russell Kane and Zoe Lyons on the comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on the major news stories from July 2014 and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Big Zuu's Big Eats
programme.desc: On the latest leg of his road trip, Zuu ventures into the unknown - travelling from his native West London, all the way to Hackney in East London to cook for comedian Jamali Maddix.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Ed Byrne, Gary Delaney, Katherine Ryan and Josh Widdicombe for an edition of the comedy quiz from September 2014. The panellists give their take on major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actor Danny Dyer takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with comedian Sara Pascoe and tennis coach Judy Murray joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave Gorman performs another of his witty stand-up shows, looking at 'fun facts', the public's perception of Richard Branson and why David Dickinson must be stopped in his tracks.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8.

programme.title: Secrets of the Third Reich
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Third Reich: The Nazi Gold Train
programme.desc: Part one of two. The search for a missing train containing Nazi treasure, which was believed to have been hidden in the mountains of Poland.

programme.title: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: Jackie Kennedy's relationship with her sister Lee, which was a source of support in the wake of her husband's death but fell apart after her second marriage.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: The relationships between female historical figures and their sisters, beginning with the story of Amelia Earhart and her sibling and biographer Grace Muriel.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: The story of Henri Charrierre's book Papillon, which he claimed was a true account of his time in the Devil's Island penal colony, but was later exposed as fiction.

programme.title: Big in America: British Hits in the USA
programme.desc: Compilation of British rock 'n' roll acts in performance, featuring songs that crossed over to the US charts. From the Dave Clark Five to Coldplay, the Brits have rocked America and sometimes even done better across the pond than on home soil. A Flock of Seagulls, Supertramp and Bush also feature, alongside darker British global exports like Black Sabbath and the Cure.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Recalling a decade in British music, with archive performances from the early stages of the 'swingin' era, featuring music by by rock, pop and R'n'B artists including the Springfields, the Shadows, the Beatles and the Rolling Stones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: More pop, rock and rhythm and blues from the archives, featuring appearances by the Rolling Stones, the Dave Clark Five, the Seekers and the Byrds from 1964 and '65.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: Aircraft restoration expert Mark Masters and his son James rebuild a 1943 US Army Aeronca Defender liaison plane for its German owner.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A group of amateur pilots find their light plane has a glorious war record - and launch an ambitious project to rebuild the Piper Cub and restore its military markings.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: At St Athan in Wales, engineer John Sparks and his team of ex-Navy and RAF engineers begin the task of reassembling the Czech-built jet from nine parts delivered by lorry.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist investigates two shells that have proved to be winners in evolution - the bird's egg shell and the hard shell of the tortoise. The ostrich egg is so strong it is possible for it to take a person's weight without breaking - so how does a chick manage break out of such a fortress? The evolution of the tortoise shell was for a long time a mystery, and this bony box offers a lot more than just protection.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The evolutionary documentary concludes, as David Attenborough profiles the Siamese fighting fish, so aggressive it will fight its own reflection until it is exhausted. He also looks at the kangaroo - once pitted against humans in the boxing ring - which has a kick so strong it can kill.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: High-definition cameras and aerial photography techniques are used to explore the archipelago, which is rich in wildlife and made famous by Charles Darwin's On the Origin of the Species. This programme focuses on the geological history of the islands through the evidence of volcanic eruptions and examines what makes it unique. Tilda Swinton narrates.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Examining the lesser-known parts of the islands and the species that have successfully evolved to suit the environment. The programme discovers how tortoise shells have changed shape, flowers have turned yellow to attract bees, and finches have become warblers. Plus, how flightless cormorants are still hunting underwater. Narrated by Tilda Swinton.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: An insight into how creatures adapt to the islands' extremes of weather, including iguanas that climb more than 1,000 metres to lay eggs, fish forced to rely on the shade provided by mangroves, and seals that survive on exposed shorelines by taking shelter in lava grottos.

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Creatures that live on coral reefs, including groupers, small predators that scientists believe are as intelligent as chimpanzees. These creatures have a remarkable aptitude for communication to the point where they can interact with other species including octopi and work together to catch prey. Plus, footage of a vast spawning event involving several different species of fish, coral and invertebrates, and time-lapse photography of coral polyps growing and dying, creating a structure visible from space.

programme.title: Big in America: British Hits in the USA
programme.desc: Compilation of British rock 'n' roll acts in performance, featuring songs that crossed over to the US charts. From the Dave Clark Five to Coldplay, the Brits have rocked America and sometimes even done better across the pond than on home soil. A Flock of Seagulls, Supertramp and Bush also feature, alongside darker British global exports like Black Sabbath and the Cure.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Recalling a decade in British music, with archive performances from the early stages of the 'swingin' era, featuring music by by rock, pop and R'n'B artists including the Springfields, the Shadows, the Beatles and the Rolling Stones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: More pop, rock and rhythm and blues from the archives, featuring appearances by the Rolling Stones, the Dave Clark Five, the Seekers and the Byrds from 1964 and '65.

programme.title: Secrets of the Manor House
programme.desc: Charles Spencer leads a tour of Althorp House, Northamptonshire, which was the childhood home of his sister Diana, Princess of Wales, and also her final resting place.

programme.title: Private Lives of the Monarchs
programme.desc: The lives of some of history's most iconic kings and queens. Tracy Borman explores Queen Victoria's relationship with her husband and her eldest son.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn visits the former HQ of London Underground, 55 Broadway, which was the capital's first skyscraper, and sees the timber-framed Barmouth Bridge in north Wales.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: The discovery of a 19th-century schooner in Lake Erie off Ohio's coast that could shed light on not just the founding of Ohio, but the settlement of North America itself.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Four bodies are found in the Thames after a boat full of illegal immigrants founders. Realising they are dealing with a people-trafficking operation gone disastrously wrong, Leo, Harry and Nikki set out to discover whether there are any survivors, while delving into the victims' pasts. Feature-length episode, guest starring Burt Kwouk.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: When Justice Isn't Enough - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. Suspected gay serial killers John Lord and Michael Keenan are brought in for questioning. In spite of the stack of circumstantial evidence against them, a confession looks a long way off as the detectives get deeply embroiled in a battle of wits. Phil Hunter is stunned when wife Cindy breaks down in his arms with news about her IVF treatment.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Sicknote spends his first night at the protest camp. Meanwhile, a shocking discovery at a hoax call leads Billy to make a big decision.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The emotional experience of delivering a baby together helps to reconcile Peggy and Ruth, while Vic learns the reason behind Stephen leaving university. Elsewhere, Mary Cooper causes chaos when she gets behind the wheel of a car. Sarah Lancashire, Pam Ferris, Tony Haygarth and Thomas Craig star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A nurse with her head full of new ideas joins the ranks, ruffling Peggy and Ruth's feathers, while Stephen's barely got his feet back under his mum's table before he's drawn into a steamy love triangle.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer whisks Charlotte away for a weekend in Wales, but before long they find themselves hunting for a murderer and a rare Celtic cross. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Caroline Langrishe.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer agrees to help Charlotte's friend Mary Gladden save a nursing home by valuing and selling its antiques - only to find himself in the line of fire as someone makes an attempt on his life. Drama, starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton, Caroline Langrishe and Susan Fleetwood.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Framed by long-time enemy Ducos for stealing Napoleon's treasures, Sharpe is abandoned by his wife Jane, and goes on the run from both the English and the French until he can prove his innocence. Period adventure, starring Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley, Abigail Cruttenden and Cecile Paoli.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Lu investigate after an ex-soap star receives death threats after rewriting Romeo and Juliet as a feminist tract. After the self-centred actress is poisoned on stage, suspects include the director who worked with her in a soap with a similar poison plot-line and his lover, an understudy to the production. Guest starring Morgana Robinson and Ramon Tikaram.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Dalziel hunts a killer with a taste for antique porcelain, while Pascoe puts his promotion celebrations on hold to investigate the shooting of three old friends and uncovers a Scottish oil fraud. Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan star, with Michael Pennington and Patrick Ryecart.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The mismatched detectives go on the trail of the Wetherton Choker, a killer who calls the local paper with a quotation from Hamlet each time he claims a victim. After the services of a fortune-teller are enlisted, suspicion falls on a nearby gypsy camp. Drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Crime author Jack Rudd visits Brokenwood to give a reading at the local book club - but he never leaves, falling victim to a method of murder portrayed in his own book.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Flambeau enlists Fr Brown's help to steal the Queen's coronation gift from the Pope. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A body is found in an ANC drinking den and Gene quickly decides a girl is guilty of the murder. However, the group's leader complicates matters by confessing to the crime to stop the suspect being deported, pitching the team into a world of illegal immigration and terrorism. Jim's report is nearly finished, but he continues to push Alex to find out what really happened to Sam Tyler.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: With the team's attention focused on investigating a diamond robbery and the murder of three gang members, Alex slips away, vowing to learn the truth about Gene Hunt. When the DCI realises what she is up to, he sets off in pursuit, knowing her discoveries will destroy his world. Final episode of the fantasy crime drama, starring Philip Glenister, Keeley Hawes, Dean Andrews and Marshall Lancaster.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry is forced to confront his past when the team reinvestigates the 33-year-old murder of a doctor whose body was found hanging from a meat hook on a butcher's stall at Smithfield Market. The butcher had gone missing on the same day, and since then the community has rallied to help his widow keep the business afloat. However, his recently discovered remains reveal a match to an unidentified person and lead to a shocking revelation for Sandra. Guest starring Ken Farrington, David Calder and Diana Quick, with Amanda Redman and Alun Armstrong.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: 1000 Heartbeats
programme.desc: Vernon Kay hosts the quiz show in which contestants' pulses are monitored and they must complete seven rounds before their hearts beat 1,000 times to win 25,000 - meaning they will have to stay calm under pressure or risk losing the jackpot.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mission Employable
programme.desc: Kids' documentary series looking at what it takes to become a professional at all kinds of exciting jobs. Agent Kym has a really cool task for her latest mission from the Agency - she's at an ice sculpting factory..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz, controlling a robot, distributes ice cream to everyone in the city. When Magoo mistakes him for a monster, he gets sprayed with ice cream..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.sub-title: At the Heart of the Crater
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that he is at the foot of a volcano, but in fact, he's next to a huge soup vat. And he sets it all awry..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz invents a cucumber that turns people into an object of worship. When Magoo sees people being drawn to Fizz and Weasel, he thinks it's zombies!.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike is running around like a headless chicken - saving Fluffy from danger, stopping the turtles from breaking everything in the house, and fighting the raccoons.

programme.title: Buck & Buddy
programme.desc: Beetle Buck and stick insect Buddy are the best of friends who like to collect unusual and interesting things from the strange world in which they live..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The police suspect Bean of stealing his landlady's jewellery - but the real culprit is a magpie he's been nursing back to health.

programme.title: NinjaGo: Masters of Spinjitzu
programme.sub-title: NinjaGo: Secrets of the Forbidden Spinjitzu

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Ben and Gwen sign up for some Laser Town awesomeness.

programme.title: Drop Dead Weird
programme.desc: Comedy drama following the adventures of an Australian family who move to an isolated seaside village in western Ireland, with the parents having a secret to hide.

programme.title: Drop Dead Weird
programme.desc: Comedy drama following the adventures of an Australian family who move to an isolated seaside village in western Ireland, with the parents having a secret to hide.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by Level 42 singer Mark King, chefs Paul Rankin and Richard Corrigan, and food historian Dr Annie Gray. On the menu this morning are shrimp, sardines, crab and a masterclass in Swiss roll.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner put a fresh spin on some retro favourites. For starters, they prepare mackerel pt and smoked salmon mousse served with pickled cucumber. The main course is chicken kiev with a side of butter bean mash, followed by an arctic roll, a summer cocktail and a jelly dessert.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV Live: Royal Ascot
programme.desc: Coverage of today's race meetings.

programme.title: The Masked Singer US
programme.desc: More mystery celebrities battle it out in a singing contest while dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes, while a panel of more famous faces tries to guess their identities. Nick Cannon oversees the contest, as mystery singers dressed as Flower, Penguin, Eagle and Fox take to the stage, while panellists Robin Thicke, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger, and regular star of the British spin-off Ken Jeong try to work out who is behind the mask.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Celebrity contestants including McFly's Harry Judd and Paralympian Dan Powell test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian hosts a revival of classic game show Strike It Lucky. Three pairs of players will be choosing the top, middle or bottom as they navigate their way across a sea of screens, trying not to let their greed stop them banking too many prizes, and avoiding the infamous hotspots. One lucky pair will reach the endgame, where they stand to win a mountain of prizes and a luxury holiday to Las Vegas.

programme.title: Skyfall (2012)
programme.desc: James Bond pursues a mysterious criminal mastermind who has orchestrated a terrorist attack on MI6 headquarters and exposed the identities of undercover agents around the world. The trail leads to a rogue former operative who has a personal vendetta against the intelligence organisation's leader M - who is also facing calls to retire. Sam Mendes directs the 23rd instalment in the spy franchise, starring Daniel Craig as 007, with Javier Bardem, Judi Dench, Ralph Fiennes, Naomie Harris and Ben Whishaw.

programme.title: Play to the Whistle
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby welcomes footballerAshley Cole, Strictly Come Dancing 2016 winner Ore Oduba and comedian Kevin Bridges to the show. They join team captains Frank Lampard and Bradley Walsh as well as regular panellist Romesh Ranganathan and scorekeeper Seann Walsh.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring everything from giddy grandmas, cute kids and crazy animals to below-the-belt mishaps, practical jokers and painful-looking accidents.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer purchases a Mini Moke, which was designed as an off-road military vehicle, for expert mechanic Edd China to work on - before trying to sell it for a profit.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A junkyard wizard has an Oktoberfest gem with Frank Fritz's name written all over it.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: After winning the Favourite Wish-Maker Award, the team decides to build a special bike for the children of the Make-a-Wish Foundation.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: John Ponts struggles to maintain control when he encounters turbulence. The pilots are left in charge of the terminal, and Sarah's rescue mission turns into a battle for survival.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe takes on a succession of unpleasant tasks, this time learning how to make maple syrup.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How lacrosse sticks, frozen food, torches and paintbrushes are produced, and the way they have evolved with changes in technology.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacture of deep-cycle batteries, tins and optical lenses.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: In La Linea, a car hiding contraband cigarettes is stopped at the checkpoint with Gibraltar. Plus, at the port of Barcelona, one phone call sets off a major drug bust. Series following the interventions of Spain's Security and Customs Services at the nation's borders to combat the constant threat from drugs, weapons and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: A grisly arrival at Madrid Airport shocks even the most hardened Civil Guards. A passenger suitcase carrying suspect packets cause a stir in Barcelona Airport.

programme.title: Autobahn
programme.desc: A look at the Bundesautobahn 2 in Germany, one of Europe's busiest, most dangerous and most important highways. For many people it's their place of work, and many more use it to travel across Europe.

programme.title: Autobahn
programme.desc: A look at the Bundesautobahn 2 in Germany, one of Europe's busiest, most dangerous and most important highways. For many people it's their place of work, and many more use it to travel across Europe.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: The duo relocate across the Atlantic, and Mike Brewer heads to Chicago in search of a rust-free Pontiac GTO - a rare car that he knows will be perfect for kicking off Edd China's US-based workshop.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike tracks down a Lincoln Continental, which set new style standards for luxury sedans in the 1960s. However, tastes have changed, and Edd hatches a refurb plan.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to America in search of a Dodge Charger for expert mechanic Edd China to restore, but the hefty price tag attached to such a famous car could be a problem if the pair are to succeed in selling it on at a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to San Francisco in search of a Chevrolet Stepside pick-up truck free from rust, but the one he finds still needs extensive restoration from Edd China.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Cadillac coupe with minimal rust and damage. However, the interior is a different story meaning Edd China faces a challenge to turn a profit on its renovation.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer claims ownership of a 1973 Ford Mustang Mach 1, and mechanic Ant Anstead tries to restore its lost power by tuning up and enhancing the engine.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer gets a good deal on a 1957 Chevrolet and Edd China performs an excellent restoration job, but their colour choice could prove to be an expensive mistake.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead work on a 1964 Falcon Ranchero, one of the first utility vehicles, but this particular example is suffering under a coat of cheap black paint.

programme.title: Plane Reclaimers
programme.desc: Three airbuses come in from a recently defunct Lithuanian airline. The arrivals mean the team is handed the daunting task of taking off an engine worth up to $6,000,000

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen stay up late to drive out poachers from their mine. Col Duff reunites with Greg Geran in one last push to find opal before the summer heat gets too much.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead answer questions from fans across the globe, revealing the inner workings of the series as they look back at the last eight cars.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: iDrew Pritchard hts the road with upholsterer Craig. In Derbyshire a 15th-century house has some Victorian dining chairs with potential, and the duo also visit an antique centre in Lincolnshire.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Huddersfield Town v Wigan Athletic, Hull City v Charlton Athletic, and Reading v Stoke City.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Stripped Down
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sources a VW 181 Thing from a collector, but is unable to haggle the price down. After Edd China gives it a badly needed refurb, it remains unclear whether the duo will manage to make a profit.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen stay up late to drive out poachers from their mine. Col Duff reunites with Greg Geran in one last push to find opal before the summer heat gets too much.

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: With their excavator back, the duo only have 48 hours left to prove that they can get to the gold or their mining deal with Dave Thomas will be terminated.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A man risks everything in the hunt for his sister's killer, and a sexual predator is getting away with his crimes.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Louisiana student Mickey Shunick, who went missing after a night out in May 2012. Police failed to make a breakthrough until they spoted her on surveillance footage. Eventually a registered sex offender pleaded guilty to killing the 21-year-old, and also being responsible for the death of another woman whose body had been found in September 1999.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 62-year-old Narleen Campton, who was found murdered in her home, apparently having been tortured, during Thanksgiving 2011 in Newport, Washington. Though Jeremy Bryant confessed to his involvement, doubt remains over whether he acted alone.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of New Jersey state trooper Phillip Lamanco, whose killers were connected to terrorism.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Agents recall memorable cases, including the seizure of more than 30 poodles, 200 chickens being kept in inhumane temperatures exceeding 100 degrees and a house overrun by 50 rabbits.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Lisa is tasked with saving a five-year-old's paralysed dachshund, while Dr Chris is presented with a list by another little girl.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori's team tries to keep sibling rivalry in check between two sisters getting married within 30 days of each other. Plus, a country bride tries to control her bridesmaids.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Chassidy is looking for her dream dress - the problem is, so is her scene-stealing mother. Can Mum put her own agenda aside long enough to give Chassidy her day?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Untraditional bride Maranda is looking for the perfect 'out-of-the-box' magical fairy-tale dress for when she meets her husband for the first time - at the wedding.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Alex needs to find out what is wrong with a dog struggling with a heatwave. A pregnant guinea pig is being watched closely, while Dr Kate helps a baby wombat.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A woman takes her puppy for a check-up and discovers it needs major heart surgery. Following the work of Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to save two baby Tasmanian devils that are close to death following a mysterious illness, and a miniature schnauzer when it is attacked by a puffer fish.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: After marital problems and life as a single parent, Melissa struggles with weight gain during a stressful period.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Since meeting at a bariatric rehab centre in 2006, Lee and Rena's weight has skyrocketed. The couple are now taking a second attempt to save their lives.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of high-profile district attorney Ray Gricar, who went missing from his home area of Pennsylvania in April 2005. His laptop and hard drive were found destroyed in the Susquehanna River, leaving detectives wondering whether he had been murdered or gone on the run.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Rule-breaking brides visit Confetti & Lace, as blue-haired bride Stephanie wants a dress with colour and Virginia brings her fiance to help choose a gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride determined to stay within a strict budget is drawn to the most expensive dresses, while another customer insists that money is no object.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: A Thorn in the Bride's Side
programme.desc: A beauty queen visits the shop hoping to find a dress she loves and her mother-in-law approves of. Another customer has to deal with an opinionated friend.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Brides-to-be Danielle and Kathryn want the same gown - and there's only one in the sale. Meanwhile, Jessica is in search of one very specific dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A dream dress turns into a nightmare, and a customer finally finds her perfect gown - only to realise it costs double her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Eternal bridesmaid Brittany, now the bride, wants to 'drop it low' in a dress. Erika plans to wear her old wedding dress down the aisle - with a different fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer and her picky entourage return to the shop for a second look, while a bride clashes with her mother over her choice of a non-traditional gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride is racked with indecision, and a customer who wants to look like a 'classy porn star' is in for a surprise.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: After dreaming about her husband being unfaithful, Theresa coerces Larry into taking dance lessons with her, and a woman hears a message from her late spouse.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Psychic mum Theresa is in total disarray after a mole removed from her foot is tested for cancer, and a couple hear from their deceased child.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo decides to do work on the house to tackle mould, and a couple who lost their son receive a life-changing message.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa has to find alternative locations to carry out her readings amid plans for the house construction.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Featuring a woman who turned to hoarding after a shocking confession ended her marriage, and another who collects items to ease the pain of the illness that plagues her family.

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The story of Candy, who lived in the beach town of Gulfport, Florida. When she met a handsome stranger she started a fantasy romance that soon became a real-life horror story.

programme.title: Surviving Evil
programme.desc: The case of an Ohio woman, abducted and brutalised by a violent sexual predator. The victim focused her concentration on the needs of her children and resolved to survive, reasoning that the best way to remain alive was to play dead.

programme.title: The Murder Tapes
programme.desc: The murder of a loving uncle, whose body was found near a playground in New Mexico. A manhunt ensued leaving police with a major discovery that turned the case on its head.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators search in abandoned cars and shallow graves to unearth vital pieces of evidence that criminals believe are safely hidden.
